text_as_html: One natural defense to our attacks is to obfuscate the logits by adding noise. This will naturally induce a tradeoff between utility and vulnerability—more noise will result in less useful outputs, but increase extraction difficulty. We empirically measure this tradeoff in Figure 5(c). We consider noise added directly to the logits, that is consistent between different queries of the same prompt. To simulate this, we directly add noise to our recovered logits, and recompute the extracted embedding matrix. For GPT-2, we measure the RMSE between the true embedding matrix and the embedding matrix extracted with a specific noise level; for ada and babbage, we measure the RMSE between the noisy extracted weights and the weights we extracted in the absence of noise. We normalize all embedding matrices (to have ℓ2 norm 1) before measuring RMSE.

On the left, we plot the singular values that are extracted using our attack on GPT-2 small—the estimated hidden dimension is near 768. This misleads the adversary into thinking the model is wider than it actually is.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 1, 'page_number': 5, 'parent_id': 'be964f1b48584dffbd70d950be0afd3f', 'text_as_html': '', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/pdf', 'partitioner_type': 'vlm_partition', 'filename': '2403.06634.pdf'}}
text: Figure 7. On the left, we plot the singular values that are extracted using our attack on GPT-2 small—the estimated hidden dimension is near 768. On the right, we post-hoc extend the dimensionality of the weight matrix to 1024, as described in Section 8. This misleads the adversary into thinking the model is wider than it actually is.

element_id:
{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': 'f062806e4d4d63b9d06241a825146773', 'text': 'FMEA: Failure Mode and Effect Analysis. Harm: physical injury or damage to the health of people, or damage to property or the environment. Hazard: potential source of harm. Hazardous situation: circumstances in which people, property, or the environment are exposed to one or more hazard(s). Risk: combination of the probability of occurrence of harm and the severity of that harm. RPN: Risk Priority number ALARP: As Low As Reasonably Possible. AFAP: As Far as Possible.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 1, 'page_number': 1, 'parent_id': 'cff0a9d2cb5b40d88fbe48372dfe8f22', 'text_as_html': '

FMEA: Failure Mode and Effect Analysis.

Harm: physical injury or damage to the health of people, or damage to property or the environment.

Hazard: potential source of harm.

Hazardous situation: circumstances in which people, property, or the environment are exposed to one or more hazard(s).

Risk: combination of the probability of occurrence of harm and the severity of that harm.

RPN: Risk Priority number

ALARP: As Low As Reasonably Possible.

AFAP: As Far as Possible.

', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/pdf', 'partitioner_type': 'vlm_partition', 'filename': 'RMP - Bonded Manifolds - Rev B_scanned for TF.pdf'}}
text: FMEA: Failure Mode and Effect Analysis. Harm: physical injury or damage to the health of people, or damage to property or the environment. Hazard: potential source of harm. Hazardous situation: circumstances in which people, property, or the environment are exposed to one or more hazard(s). Risk: combination of the probability of occurrence of harm and the severity of that harm. RPN: Risk Priority number ALARP: As Low As Reasonably Possible. AFAP: As Far as Possible.

text_as_html:
FMEA: Failure Mode and Effect Analysis.

Harm: physical injury or damage to the health of people, or damage to property or the environment.

Hazard: potential source of harm.

Hazardous situation: circumstances in which people, property, or the environment are exposed to one or more hazard(s).

Risk: combination of the probability of occurrence of harm and the severity of that harm.

RPN: Risk Priority number

ALARP: As Low As Reasonably Possible.

AFAP: As Far as Possible.

text_as_html: 4.1. Risk Management Process description:

element_id:
{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': 'b8d40447711458747d59bed8d1f7bce9', 'text': 'Risk Management process will be performed as required by ISO 14971:2007 and BS EN ISO 14971:2012, ("Medical Devices – Application of risk management to medical devices") and in accordance with Elcam\'s SOP# 03-01-21. The process will include Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control and at the end of the process also Production & Post Production information. (The method for risk analysis and evaluation to be used is mainly FMEA (Fail Mode & Effect Analysis). Other techniques will be used as well when needed. The emphasis will be on risks primarily to the patient, but also to the operator, other persons, other equipment and the environment occurs during the product shelf life and/or in-use life. Risks which effect Elcam\'s image or Elcam\'s manufacturing facilities that do not affect product\'s safety or performance are not included within this Risk Management Process.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 1, 'page_number': 2, 'parent_id': '0dcdc667d4aa4ec1a96b49b6491a2a21', 'text_as_html': '

Risk Management process will be performed as required by ISO 14971:2007 and BS EN ISO 14971:2012, ("Medical Devices – Application of risk management to medical devices") and in accordance with Elcam\'s SOP# 03-01-21.

The process will include Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control and at the end of the process also Production & Post Production information.

(The method for risk analysis and evaluation to be used is mainly FMEA (Fail Mode & Effect Analysis). Other techniques will be used as well when needed.

The emphasis will be on risks primarily to the patient, but also to the operator, other persons, other equipment and the environment occurs during the product shelf life and/or in-use life. Risks which effect Elcam\'s image or Elcam\'s manufacturing facilities that do not affect product\'s safety or performance are not included within this Risk Management Process.

text_as_html:
Risk Management process will be performed as required by ISO 14971:2007 and BS EN ISO 14971:2012, ("Medical Devices – Application of risk management to medical devices") and in accordance with Elcam's SOP# 03-01-21.

The process will include Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control and at the end of the process also Production & Post Production information.

(The method for risk analysis and evaluation to be used is mainly FMEA (Fail Mode & Effect Analysis). Other techniques will be used as well when needed.

The emphasis will be on risks primarily to the patient, but also to the operator, other persons, other equipment and the environment occurs during the product shelf life and/or in-use life. Risks which effect Elcam's image or Elcam's manufacturing facilities that do not affect product's safety or performance are not included within this Risk Management Process.

text_as_html:
First step is listing the intended use or purpose of the product and its characteristics related to its safety.

Then, identifying the known or foreseeable hazards and hazardous situations in normal and fault conditions, their causes and estimating the risks for each hazardous situation. This identification will initially be performed by a review meeting after design Input phase, after establishing the Device Requirements and the Product Specifications.

text_as_html:
The identified hazardous situations are evaluated for their risk probability of occurrence (P), severity (S) and detectability (D) according to the scales described below. Afterwards the RPN number is calculated by multiplying the ratings for each hazard and the acceptability is determined according to the acceptance criteria.

Each parameter (P, S, or D) will be analyzed in order to rank and estimate the risk:

element_id:
{'type': 'Table', 'element_id': '79aa1de45d96de2e85df4d38583df1f8', 'text': 'S Rating Severity Severity to Patient/User Severity to Elcam Severity to Manufacture 1 Minor All is fine up to small discomfort, minor damage in performance. All is fine up to deviations in spec border. Small effect on equipment or product, a few production hours loss. 2 Medium Degradation in performance without harm. Damage to image, do not meet spec. Degradation in equipment or its operation small effect on product in non-functional characters, a few days loss. 4 Severe The part does not function but does not cause harm. Need to replace parts, severe impact to image, will not meet fundamental characteristic in spec. Medium degradation in equipment or its operation affecting product in non-functional characters, two-three weeks loss. 6 Severe - critical The product does not function and causes injury or condition requiring medical treatment. Severe impact to image, product will not meet the requirements of spec, market loss. High deterioration in equipment or its operation severely affecting production or product functionality, several week losses. 8 Critical Severe harm to patient: death, irreversible injury or condition or long term medical aid. Low suit, market loss. Severe damage to equipment, not being able to produce at all or producing non-functional products, loss of more than month and a half.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 2, 'page_number': 1, 'parent_id': '598d437f37c646e2af855951e52953c4', 'text_as_html': '

8CriticalSevere harm to patient: death, irreversible injury or condition or long term medical aid.Low suit, market loss.Severe damage to equipment, not being able to produce at all or producing non-functional products, loss of more than month and a half.

text: S Rating Severity Severity to Patient/User Severity to Elcam Severity to Manufacture 1 Minor All is fine up to small discomfort, minor damage in performance. All is fine up to deviations in spec border. Small effect on equipment or product, a few production hours loss. 2 Medium Degradation in performance without harm. Damage to image, do not meet spec. Degradation in equipment or its operation small effect on product in non-functional characters, a few days loss. 4 Severe The part does not function but does not cause harm. Need to replace parts, severe impact to image, will not meet fundamental characteristic in spec. Medium degradation in equipment or its operation affecting product in non-functional characters, two-three weeks loss. 6 Severe - critical The product does not function and causes injury or condition requiring medical treatment. Severe impact to image, product will not meet the requirements of spec, market loss. High deterioration in equipment or its operation severely affecting production or product functionality, several week losses. 8 Critical Severe harm to patient: death, irreversible injury or condition or long term medical aid. Low suit, market loss. Severe damage to equipment, not being able to produce at all or producing non-functional products, loss of more than month and a half.

text_as_html:
D RatingDefect Detection
1Defect, if occurred, will always be detected at Elcam during production.
2Defect, if occurred, will occasionally be detected at Elcam during production.
3Defects, if occurred, will rarely be detected at Elcam or Will be detected by customer (not end user).
4Defects, if occurred, will not be detected at Elcam. It will always be detected by the end user.

According to the calculated RPN value the priority for mitigation is determined (Risk Priority Level).

Yellow area – Medium rated risks. *Risks in the ALARP/AFAP area (ALARP is according to definition of ISO 14971:2007 AFAP is according to definition in BS EN ISO 14971:2012). Acceptable but require additional controls and monitoring. There should be actions to reduce them further and they require periodical review. element_id:
{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': 'e479cb89cd8006536cbafd0524de3d5d', 'text': "Risk Control includes defining the measures to be taken in order to reduce the risks, Implementation of the risk control measures and verification of their implementation and their effectiveness, Residual Risk Evaluation after the Implementation. If measures are not practical Risk to Benefit Analysis should be made in order to demonstrate whether the products' benefits outweigh the residual risk. Risks arising from the risk control measures should be identified as well. At the end of the risk control measures, the Acceptability of the Overall Residual Risk is to be documented.", 'metadata': {'category_depth': 1, 'page_number': 1, 'parent_id': 'c263cdda377c4cdd81c590dd72377010', 'text_as_html': '

Risk Control includes defining the measures to be taken in order to reduce the risks, Implementation of the risk control measures and verification of their implementation and their effectiveness, Residual Risk Evaluation after the Implementation. If measures are not practical Risk to Benefit Analysis should be made in order to demonstrate whether the products\' benefits outweigh the residual risk. Risks arising from the risk control measures should be identified as well.

At the end of the risk control measures, the Acceptability of the Overall Residual Risk is to be documented.

', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/pdf', 'partitioner_type': 'vlm_partition', 'filename': 'RMP - Bonded Manifolds - Rev B_scanned for TF.pdf'}}
text: Risk Control includes defining the measures to be taken in order to reduce the risks, Implementation of the risk control measures and verification of their implementation and their effectiveness, Residual Risk Evaluation after the Implementation. If measures are not practical Risk to Benefit Analysis should be made in order to demonstrate whether the products' benefits outweigh the residual risk. Risks arising from the risk control measures should be identified as well. At the end of the risk control measures, the Acceptability of the Overall Residual Risk is to be documented.

', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/pdf', 'partitioner_type': 'vlm_partition', 'filename': 'RMP - Bonded Manifolds - Rev B_scanned for TF.pdf'}

text_as_html:
Risk Control includes defining the measures to be taken in order to reduce the risks, Implementation of the risk control measures and verification of their implementation and their effectiveness, Residual Risk Evaluation after the Implementation. If measures are not practical Risk to Benefit Analysis should be made in order to demonstrate whether the products' benefits outweigh the residual risk. Risks arising from the risk control measures should be identified as well.

At the end of the risk control measures, the Acceptability of the Overall Residual Risk is to be documented.

text_as_html:
Manufacturing Eng, QA, Marketing, production etc. including someone not directly involved in the project or product).

- Reviews in order to verify that mitigation activities were performed and assessment of their effectiveness are to be performed by the person in charge of risk management from QA and the project manager.

- Overall residual risks acceptability and Risk to benefit analysis is also to be performed by QA and project manager.

- Other risk reviews in order to view the pre-identified hazards, risks, their evaluations and their relevance and to identify new hazards will be performed in a risk review meeting with representatives of all relevant departments.

{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': '716f8ca07cd5696422bfddfe0acfa439', 'text': 'The Risk Management Process will be documented in the product\'s Design History File (DHF). It will be according to the format specified in Appendix 5 of SOP#3-01-21. The risk management file will be managed as a controlled document, revised with the progression of the risk management process and all its revisions will be kept for process tracking in the design history file. Risk general management documents related to production and post production stages will be documented separately afterwards in "Risk Management" folder at the EPDM system.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 1, 'page_number': 2, 'parent_id': '0cfec1df80024aaea2250213351f4de4', 'text_as_html': '

text_as_html:
The Risk Management Process will be documented in the product's Design History File (DHF). It will be according to the format specified in Appendix 5 of SOP#3-01-21. The risk management file will be managed as a controlled document, revised with the progression of the risk management process and all its revisions will be kept for process tracking in the design history file.

Risk general management documents related to production and post production stages will be documented separately afterwards in "Risk Management" folder at the EPDM system.

element_id: {'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': 'a2763acd7a3f549c56ab41e0c6db70d6', 'text': 'Risk Management process will be performed as required by ISO 14971:2007 and BS EN ISO 14971:2012, ("Medical Devices – Application of risk management to medical devices") and in accordance with Elcam\'s SOP# 03-01-21.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': '2021d894eaaee156a8dd330deeb6b6c0'}}
text: Risk Management process will be performed as required by ISO 14971:2007 and BS EN ISO 14971:2012, ("Medical Devices – Application of risk management to medical devices") and in accordance with Elcam's SOP# 03-01-21.
metadata: {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': '2021d894eaaee156a8dd330deeb6b6c0'}

element_id: {'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': 'c3518e5e4ca0d99425fc35b5962a70c1', 'text': 'The process will include Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control and at the end of the process also Production & Post Production information.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'emphasized_text_contents': ['Risk Analysis', 'Risk Evaluation', 'Risk Control', 'Production & Post Production information.'], 'emphasized_text_tags': ['b', 'b', 'b', 'b'], 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': '2021d894eaaee156a8dd330deeb6b6c0'}}
text: The process will include Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control and at the end of the process also Production & Post Production information.
metadata: {'category_depth': 0, 'emphasized_text_contents': ['Risk Analysis', 'Risk Evaluation', 'Risk Control', 'Production & Post Production information.'], 'emphasized_text_tags': ['b', 'b', 'b', 'b'], 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': '2021d894eaaee156a8dd330deeb6b6c0'}

element_id: {'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': '289d39e419615f47a3c08f69afd9e294', 'text': '(The method for risk analysis and evaluation to be used is mainly FMEA (Fail Mode & Effect Analysis). Other techniques will be used as well when needed. ', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'emphasized_text_contents': ['FMEA'], 'emphasized_text_tags': ['b'], 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': '2021d894eaaee156a8dd330deeb6b6c0'}}
text: (The method for risk analysis and evaluation to be used is mainly FMEA (Fail Mode & Effect Analysis). Other techniques will be used as well when needed.
metadata: {'category_depth': 0, 'emphasized_text_contents': ['FMEA'], 'emphasized_text_tags': ['b'], 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': '2021d894eaaee156a8dd330deeb6b6c0'}

element_id: {'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': 'e44aee07de79a675214f68c66a5b63c8', 'text': "The emphasis will be on risks primarily to the patient, but also to the operator, other persons, other equipment and the environment occurs during the product shelf life and/or in-use life. Risks which effect Elcam's image or Elcam's manufacturing facilities that do not affect product's safety or performance are not included within this Risk Management Process.", 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': '2021d894eaaee156a8dd330deeb6b6c0'}}
text: The emphasis will be on risks primarily to the patient, but also to the operator, other persons, other equipment and the environment occurs during the product shelf life and/or in-use life. Risks which effect Elcam's image or Elcam's manufacturing facilities that do not affect product's safety or performance are not included within this Risk Management Process.
metadata: {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': '2021d894eaaee156a8dd330deeb6b6c0'}

', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': '2021d894eaaee156a8dd330deeb6b6c0'}}

{'type': 'Table', 'element_id': 'ab2354b0c7cea2a5d954da106df6d3e6', 'text': 'S Rating Severity Severity to Patient/User Severity to Elcam Severity to Manufacture 1 Minor All is fine up to small discomfort, minor damage in performance. All is fine up to deviations in spec border. Small effect on equipment or product, a few production hours loss. 2 Medium Degradation in performance without harm. Damage to image, do not meet spec. Degradation in equipment or its operation small effect on product in non-functional characters, a few days loss. 4 Severe The part does not function but does not cause harm. Need to replace parts, severe impact to image, will not meet fundamental characteristic in spec. Medium degradation in equipment or its operation affecting product in non-functional characters, two-three weeks loss. 6 Severe - critical The product does not function and causes injury or condition requiring medical treatment. Severe impact to image, product will not meet the requirements of spec, market loss. High deterioration in equipment or its operation severely affecting production or product functionality, several week losses. 8 Critical Severe harm to patient: death, irreversible injury or condition or long term medical aid. Low suit, market loss. 4SevereThe part does not function but does not cause harm.Need to replace parts, severe impact to image, will not meet fundamental characteristic in spec.Medium degradation in equipment or its operation affecting product in non-functional characters, two-three weeks loss.

8CriticalSevere harm to patient: death, irreversible injury or condition or long term medical aid.Low suit, market loss.Severe damage to equipment, not being able to produce at all or producing non-functional products, loss of more than month and a half.
', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': '2021d894eaaee156a8dd330deeb6b6c0'}
text_as_html:
S RatingSeveritySeverity to Patient/UserSeverity to ElcamSeverity to Manufacture
1MinorAll is fine up to small discomfort, minor damage in performance.All is fine up to deviations in spec border.Small effect on equipment or product, a few production hours loss.
2MediumDegradation in performance without harm.Damage to image, do not meet spec.Degradation in equipment or its operation small effect on product in non-functional characters, a few days loss.
4SevereThe part does not function but does not cause harm.Need to replace parts, severe impact to image, will not meet fundamental characteristic in spec.Medium degradation in equipment or its operation affecting product in non-functional characters, two-three weeks loss.
6Severe - criticalThe product does not function and causes injury or condition requiring medical treatment.Severe impact to image, product will not meet the requirements of spec, market loss.High deterioration in equipment or its operation severely affecting production or product functionality, several week losses.
8CriticalSevere harm to patient: death, irreversible injury or condition or long term medical aid.Low suit, market loss.Severe damage to equipment, not being able to produce at all or producing non-functional products, loss of more than month and a half.

element_id: {'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': '239762c2f12212a49261b2877e9180e2', 'text': 'Risk Control includes defining the measures to be taken in order to reduce the risks, Implementation of the risk control measures and verification of their implementation and their effectiveness, Residual Risk Evaluation after the Implementation. If measures are not practical Risk to Benefit Analysis should be made in order to demonstrate whether the products` benefits outweigh the residual risk. Risks arising from the risk control measures should be identified as well.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'emphasized_text_contents': ['defining', 'Implementation', 'Residual Risk Evaluation', 'Risk to Benefit Analysis', 'Risks arising from the risk control measures'], 'emphasized_text_tags': ['b', 'b', 'b', 'b', 'b'], 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}}
text: Risk Control includes defining the measures to be taken in order to reduce the risks, Implementation of the risk control measures and verification of their implementation and their effectiveness, Residual Risk Evaluation after the Implementation. If measures are not practical Risk to Benefit Analysis should be made in order to demonstrate whether the products` benefits outweigh the residual risk. Risks arising from the risk control measures should be identified as well.
metadata: {'category_depth': 0, 'emphasized_text_contents': ['defining', 'Implementation', 'Residual Risk Evaluation', 'Risk to Benefit Analysis', 'Risks arising from the risk control measures'], 'emphasized_text_tags': ['b', 'b', 'b', 'b', 'b'], 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}

element_id: {'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': 'f62bcdcc59992be85910a23c49d8fd2b', 'text': 'At the end of the risk control measures, the Acceptability of the Overall Residual Risk is to be documented. element_id: {'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': '4a6cf1c104cab8f87c66eeb4f5b2a0c1', 'text': "After the end of the development phase, for each family of products, the risks should be reviewed according to information gained from the production of the device and afterwards information after the device is being sent to customers (customers' feedback and satisfaction, complaints, information from users, operators etc.). This information shall be evaluated to identify any unrecognized hazards and hazardous situations and to evaluate acceptability of risks that were identified previously.", 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}}
text: After the end of the development phase, for each family of products, the risks should be reviewed according to information gained from the production of the device and afterwards information after the device is being sent to customers (customers' feedback and satisfaction, complaints, information from users, operators etc.). This information shall be evaluated to identify any unrecognized hazards and hazardous situations and to evaluate acceptability of risks that were identified previously.
metadata: {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}

element_id: {'type': 'ListItem', 'element_id': '0e51a6e0a6ebdf0f8ec34411c1a24669', 'text': 'After each important phase during product lifecycle a risk review meeting is to be performed (Initial risk review meeting: after Design Input).', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}}
text: After each important phase during product lifecycle a risk review meeting is to be performed (Initial risk review meeting: after Design Input).
metadata: {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}

element_id: {'type': 'ListItem', 'element_id': '0980aa485596eb32cb099f297a46c38d', 'text': 'The Risk Analysis, Evaluation and Control activities are to be initially identified by a review meeting attending represents of all relevant departments (R&D, Manufacturing Eng, QA, Marketing, production etc. including someone not directly involved in the project or product).', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}}
text: The Risk Analysis, Evaluation and Control activities are to be initially identified by a review meeting attending represents of all relevant departments (R&D, Manufacturing Eng, QA, Marketing, production etc. including someone not directly involved in the project or product).
metadata: {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}

element_id: {'type': 'ListItem', 'element_id': 'c359029bc726383cc76adea6846d7993', 'text': 'Reviews in order to verify that mitigation activities were performed and assessment of their effectiveness are to be performed by the person in charge of risk management from QA and the project manager.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}}
text: Reviews in order to verify that mitigation activities were performed and assessment of their effectiveness are to be performed by the person in charge of risk management from QA and the project manager.
metadata: {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}

element_id: {'type': 'ListItem', 'element_id': 'dab09ea1622059a1e336fd358e981e59', 'text': 'Overall residual risks acceptability and Risk to benefit analysis is also to be performed by QA and project manager.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}}
text: Overall residual risks acceptability and Risk to benefit analysis is also to be performed by QA and project manager.
metadata: {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}

element_id: {'type': 'ListItem', 'element_id': '7d4038652a3e4f08edb2c42bec02f61a', 'text': 'Other risk reviews in order to view the pre-identified hazards, risks, their evaluations and their relevance and to identify new hazards will be performed in a risk review meeting with representatives of all relevant departments.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}}
text: Other risk reviews in order to view the pre-identified hazards, risks, their evaluations and their relevance and to identify new hazards will be performed in a risk review meeting with representatives of all relevant departments.

text: Documenting Risk Management Process
metadata: {'category_depth': 0, 'emphasized_text_contents': ['Documenting Risk Management Process'], 'emphasized_text_tags': ['b'], 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}

element_id: {'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': '623d3d9687470049b14f1d225ef16b27', 'text': "The Risk Management Process will be documented in the product's Design History File (DHF).  It will be according to the format specified in Appendix 5 or 8 of SOP #3-01-21. The risk management file will be managed as a controlled document, revised with the progression of the risk management process and all its revisions will be kept for process tracking in the design history file.", 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}}
text: The Risk Management Process will be documented in the product's Design History File (DHF).  It will be according to the format specified in Appendix 5 or 8 of SOP #3-01-21. The risk management file will be managed as a controlled document, revised with the progression of the risk management process and all its revisions will be kept for process tracking in the design history file.
metadata: {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}

', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}}

element_id: {'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': 'a8d53270657f52cdbaa1af83abab38c0', 'text': 'This document outlines the risk management activities for the Bonded Manifolds family of products. The product lifecycle stages in which this plan is applicable are as described in the scope.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 0, 'filename': 'Risk Management Plan - Bonded Manifolds.doc', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/msword', 'parent_id': 'fa36c144a3952ba69d3aab6a306f544b'}}
text: This document outlines the risk management activities for the Bonded Manifolds family of products. It determines the scales of rating them and the Risk Priority Levels. It also determines the means of reviewing and verifying them and the responsibilities. The product lifecycle stages in which this plan is applicable are as described in the scope.

{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': 'ec7482aaef3802f4e38663a4f54cf36c', 'text': 'FMEA: Failure Mode and Effect Analysis. Harm: physical injury or damage to the health of people, or damage to property or the environment. Hazard: potential source of harm. Hazardous situation: circumstances in which people, property, or the environment are exposed to one or more hazard(s). Risk: combination of the probability of occurrence of harm and the severity of that harm. RPN: Risk Priority number', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 2, 'page_number': 1, 'parent_id': '774d6609b7444584a4068156e797ede1', 'text_as_html': '

Harm: physical injury or damage to the health of people, or damage to property or the environment.

Hazard: potential source of harm.

Hazardous situation: circumstances in which people, property, or the environment are exposed to one or more hazard(s).

Risk: combination of the probability of occurrence of harm and the severity of that harm.

RPN: Risk Priority number

', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/pdf', 'partitioner_type': 'vlm_partition', 'filename': 'RMP - Bonded Manufolds - Rev A.pdf'}}

text_as_html:
FMEA: Failure Mode and Effect Analysis.

Harm: physical injury or damage to the health of people, or damage to property or the environment.

Hazard: potential source of harm.

Hazardous situation: circumstances in which people, property, or the environment are exposed to one or more hazard(s).

Risk: combination of the probability of occurrence of harm and the severity of that harm.

RPN: Risk Priority number

{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': '913615934e412b3143650f58e19fe7e7', 'text': '4.1. Risk Management Process description: Risk Management process will be performed as required by ISO 14971:2007 and BS EN ISO 14971:2012, ("Medical Devices – Application of risk management to medical devices") and in accordance with Elcam\'s SOP# 03-01-21. The process will include Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control and at the end of the process also Production & Post Production information. Method description (The method for risk analysis and evaluation to be used is mainly FMEA (Fail Mode & Effect Analysis). Other techniques will be used as well when needed. The emphasis will be on risks primarily to the patient, but also to the operator, other persons, other equipment and the environment occurs during the product shelf life and/or in-use life. Risks which effect Elcam\'s image or Elcam\'s manufacturing facilities that do not affect product\'s safety or performance are not included within this Risk Management Process. 4.1.1. Risk Analysis: First step is listing the intended use or purpose of the product and its characteristics related to its safety. Then, identifying the known or foreseeable hazards and hazardous situations in normal and fault conditions, their causes and estimating the risks for each hazardous situation. This identification will initially be performed by a review meeting after design Input phase, after establishing the Device Requirements and the Product Specifications. 4.1.2. Risk Evaluation: The identified hazardous situations are evaluated for their risk probability of occurrence (P), severity (S) and detectability (D) according to the scales described below. Afterwards the RPN number is calculated by multiplying the ratings for each hazard and the acceptability is determined according to the acceptance criteria. Each parameter (P, S, or D) will be analyzed in order to rank and estimate the risk:', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 2, 'page_number': 2, 'parent_id': '90b680b017334d74b31cf79152c09db1', 'text_as_html': '

4.1. Risk Management Process description:

Risk Management process will be performed as required by ISO 14971:2007 and BS EN ISO 14971:2012, ("Medical Devices – Application of risk management to medical devices") and in accordance with Elcam\'s SOP# 03-01-21.

The process will include Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control and at the end of the process also Production & Post Production information.

Method description

(The method for risk analysis and evaluation to be used is mainly FMEA (Fail Mode & Effect Analysis). Other techniques will be used as well when needed.

The emphasis will be on risks primarily to the patient, but also to the operator, other persons, other equipment and the environment occurs during the product shelf life and/or in-use life. Risks which effect Elcam\'s image or Elcam\'s manufacturing facilities that do not affect product\'s safety or performance are not included within this Risk Management Process.

4.1.1. Risk Analysis:

First step is listing the intended use or purpose of the product and its characteristics related to its safety.

Then, identifying the known or foreseeable hazards and hazardous situations in normal and fault conditions, their causes and estimating the risks for each hazardous situation. This identification will initially be performed by a review meeting after design Input phase, after establishing the Device Requirements and the Product Specifications.

4.1.2. Risk Evaluation:

The identified hazardous situations are evaluated for their risk probability of occurrence (P), severity (S) and detectability (D) according to the scales described below. Afterwards the RPN number is calculated by multiplying the ratings for each hazard and the acceptability is determined according to the acceptance criteria.

Each parameter (P, S, or D) will be analyzed in order to rank and estimate the risk:

text_as_html:
4.1. Risk Management Process description:

Risk Management process will be performed as required by ISO 14971:2007 and BS EN ISO 14971:2012, ("Medical Devices – Application of risk management to medical devices") and in accordance with Elcam's SOP# 03-01-21.

The process will include Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control and at the end of the process also Production & Post Production information.

Method description

(The method for risk analysis and evaluation to be used is mainly FMEA (Fail Mode & Effect Analysis). Other techniques will be used as well when needed.

The emphasis will be on risks primarily to the patient, but also to the operator, other persons, other equipment and the environment occurs during the product shelf life and/or in-use life. Risks which effect Elcam's image or Elcam's manufacturing facilities that do not affect product's safety or performance are not included within this Risk Management Process.

4.1.1. Risk Analysis:

First step is listing the intended use or purpose of the product and its characteristics related to its safety.

Then, identifying the known or foreseeable hazards and hazardous situations in normal and fault conditions, their causes and estimating the risks for each hazardous situation. This identification will initially be performed by a review meeting after design Input phase, after establishing the Device Requirements and the Product Specifications.

4.1.2. Risk Evaluation:

The identified hazardous situations are evaluated for their risk probability of occurrence (P), severity (S) and detectability (D) according to the scales described below. Afterwards the RPN number is calculated by multiplying the ratings for each hazard and the acceptability is determined according to the acceptance criteria.

Each parameter (P, S, or D) will be analyzed in order to rank and estimate the risk:

All is fine up to deviations in spec border Small affect on equipment or product, a few production hours loss. 2 Medium Degradation in performance without harm Damage to image, do not meet spec Degradation in equipment or its operation small affect on product in non functional characters, a few days loss. 4 Severe The part does not function but does not cause harm Need to replace parts, severe impact to image, will not meet fundamental characteristic in spec. text_as_html:
RPN calculation:

The calculation of the Risk Priority Number (RPN) is done by multiplying the risk analysis values: RPN = P x S x D.

According to the calculated RPN value the acceptability is determined.

Risk Acceptance Criteria:

Acceptable but require additional controls and monitoring. There should be actions to reduce them further And they require periodical review. Red area - Unacceptable risk, additional actions should be taken to reduce this risk. 4.1.3. Risk Control: For each risk, according to the RPN number, Risk Control measures should be taken in order to reduce the severity of the harm or reduce the probability of its occurrence. text_as_html:
*ALARP - As Low As Reasonably Possible. AFAP – As Far as Possible.

Green area - Acceptable risks.

Yellow area - Risks in the ALARP/AFAP area (ALARP is according to definition of ISO 14971:2007 AFAP is according to definition in BS EN ISO 14971:2012). Acceptable but require additional controls and monitoring. There should be actions to reduce them further And they require periodical review.

Red area - Unacceptable risk, additional actions should be taken to reduce this risk.

4.1.3. Risk Control:

For each risk, according to the RPN number, Risk Control measures should be taken in order to reduce the severity of the harm or reduce the probability of its occurrence.

The risk control measures should be one or more of the following options in the priority order listed:

element_id:
{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': 'c913edd99611c5171dc2f8da0310689f', 'text': "Risk Control includes defining the measures to be taken in order to reduce the risks, Implementation of the risk control measures and verification of their implementation and their effectiveness, Residual Risk Evaluation after the Implementation. If measures are not practical Risk to Benefit Analysis should be made in order to demonstrate whether the products' benefits outweigh the residual risk. Risks arising from the risk control measures should be identified as well. At the end of the risk control measures, the Acceptability of the Overall Residual Risk is to be documented.", 'metadata': {'category_depth': 2, 'page_number': 1, 'parent_id': 'bce1513e005a45e2b81bd7b14e5d6986', 'text_as_html': '

Risk Control includes defining the measures to be taken in order to reduce the risks, Implementation of the risk control measures and verification of their implementation and their effectiveness, Residual Risk Evaluation after the Implementation. If measures are not practical Risk to Benefit Analysis should be made in order to demonstrate whether the products\' benefits outweigh the residual risk. Risks arising from the risk control measures should be identified as well.

At the end of the risk control measures, the Acceptability of the Overall Residual Risk is to be documented.

', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/pdf', 'partitioner_type': 'vlm_partition', 'filename': 'RMP - Bonded Manufolds - Rev A.pdf'}}
text: Risk Control includes defining the measures to be taken in order to reduce the risks, Implementation of the risk control measures and verification of their implementation and their effectiveness, Residual Risk Evaluation after the Implementation. If measures are not practical Risk to Benefit Analysis should be made in order to demonstrate whether the products' benefits outweigh the residual risk. Risks arising from the risk control measures should be identified as well. At the end of the risk control measures, the Acceptability of the Overall Residual Risk is to be documented.

If measures are not practical Risk to Benefit Analysis should be made in order to demonstrate whether the products\' benefits outweigh the residual risk. ', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/pdf', 'partitioner_type': 'vlm_partition', 'filename': 'RMP - Bonded Manufolds - Rev A.pdf'}
text_as_html:
Risk Control includes defining the measures to be taken in order to reduce the risks, Implementation of the risk control measures and verification of their implementation and their effectiveness, Residual Risk Evaluation after the Implementation. If measures are not practical Risk to Benefit Analysis should be made in order to demonstrate whether the products' benefits outweigh the residual risk. Risks arising from the risk control measures should be identified as well.

At the end of the risk control measures, the Acceptability of the Overall Residual Risk is to be documented.

text_as_html:
• After each important phase during product lifecycle a risk review meeting is to be performed (Initial risk review meeting: after Design Input).
  • The Risk Analysis, Evaluation and Control activities are to be initially identified by a review meeting attending represents of all relevant departments (R&D, Manufacturing Eng, QA, Marketing, production etc. including someone not directly involved in the project or product).
  • Reviews in order to verify that mitigation activities were performed and assessment of their effectiveness are to be performed by the person in charge of risk management from QA and the project manager.

element_id:
{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': '4462ccbc982fd95408e89d06677751e8', 'text': '4.3.1. Responsibility for assuring that the risk management activities are done is by the Project Manager. 4.3.2. Person In charge for Risk Management activities execution: Quality Engineer in R&D. 4.3.3. element_id:
{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': '28326b254735ec90efaaef3eb20a145f', 'text': 'The aim of this project is to approve 2,3 and 4 gang bonded manifold blistered and sterilized by one cycle of gamma radiation. The bonded stopcocks are of LB (Discofix) and closed stopcock (UltraPort). The project is classified as a design project. about 3 years ago a design project of bonding economy and LB stopcocks for another Elcam\'s customer was performed. This document contains the Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control of the bonded manifolds. The purpose of this document is to identify and minimize risks involved in the design and use of the product using FMEA (Failure Mode & Effect Analysis) method by calculating RPN value (Risk Priority Number), evaluated by the severity, probability and detectability (the rank is described in the "Scale" worksheet). This project has finished Validation. This document Does not include risks from the Injection molding of parts, assembly of stopcocks and assembly of the HR valve. These risks are the same as non-bonded stopcocks and closed stopcocks therefore for risks related to these production processes see documents: "Risk Analysis for stopcocks and manifolds", rev D, March 20, 2014 and "closed stopcocks FMEA", RevE, March 20, 2014. Both documents exist in Nts02:quality/Risk Management Process. This revision updated after gathering information from customer complains, production complains and clinical evaluation for 2013.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 2, 'page_number': 1, 'parent_id': '4dbf48e92c5043c8ac33e3dfb9dd3131', 'text_as_html': '

The aim of this project is to approve 2,3 and 4 gang bonded manifold blistered and sterilized by one cycle of gamma radiation. The bonded stopcocks are of LB (Discofix) and closed stopcock (UltraPort). The project is classified as a design project.

about 3 years ago a design project of bonding economy and LB stopcocks for another Elcam\'s customer was performed.

This document contains the Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control of the bonded manifolds. The purpose of this document is to identify and minimize risks involved in the design and use of the product using FMEA (Failure Mode & Effect Analysis) method by calculating RPN value (Risk Priority Number), evaluated by the severity, probability and detectability (the rank is described in the "Scale" worksheet).

This project has finished Validation.

This document Does not include risks from the Injection molding of parts, assembly of stopcocks and assembly of the HR valve.

These risks are the same as non-bonded stopcocks and closed stopcocks therefore for risks related to these production processes see documents: "Risk Analysis for stopcocks and manifolds", rev D, March 20, 2014 and "closed stopcocks FMEA", RevE, March 20, 2014.

Both documents exist in Nts02:quality/Risk Management Process.

This revision updated after gathering information from customer complains, production complains and clinical evaluation for 2013.

text: The aim of this project is to approve 2,3 and 4 gang bonded manifold blistered and sterilized by one cycle of gamma radiation. The bonded stopcocks are of LB (Discofix) and closed stopcock (UltraPort). The project is classified as a design project. about 3 years ago a design project of bonding economy and LB stopcocks for another Elcam's customer was performed. This document contains the Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control of the bonded manifolds. The purpose of this document is to identify and minimize risks involved in the design and use of the product using FMEA (Failure Mode & Effect Analysis) method by calculating RPN value (Risk Priority Number), evaluated by the severity, probability and detectability (the rank is described in the "Scale" worksheet). This project has finished Validation. This document Does not include risks from the Injection molding of parts, assembly of stopcocks and assembly of the HR valve. These risks are the same as non-bonded stopcocks and closed stopcocks therefore for risks related to these production processes see documents: "Risk Analysis for stopcocks and manifolds", rev D, March 20, 2014 and "closed stopcocks FMEA", RevE, March 20, 2014. Both documents exist in Nts02:quality/Risk Management Process. This revision updated after gathering information from customer complains, production complains and clinical evaluation for 2013.

{'category_depth': 2, 'page_number': 1, 'parent_id': '4dbf48e92c5043c8ac33e3dfb9dd3131', 'text_as_html': '

The aim of this project is to approve 2,3 and 4 gang bonded manifold blistered and sterilized by one cycle of gamma radiation. The bonded stopcocks are of LB (Discofix) and closed stopcock (UltraPort). The project is classified as a design project.

about 3 years ago a design project of bonding economy and LB stopcocks for another Elcam\'s customer was performed.

This document contains the Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control of the bonded manifolds. The purpose of this document is to identify and minimize risks involved in the design and use of the product using FMEA (Failure Mode & Effect Analysis) method by calculating RPN value (Risk Priority Number), evaluated by the severity, probability and detectability (the rank is described in the "Scale" worksheet).

This project has finished Validation.

This document Does not include risks from the Injection molding of parts, assembly of stopcocks and assembly of the HR valve.

These risks are the same as non-bonded stopcocks and closed stopcocks therefore for risks related to these production processes see documents: "Risk Analysis for stopcocks and manifolds", rev D, March 20, 2014 and "closed stopcocks FMEA", RevE, March 20, 2014.

Both documents exist in Nts02:quality/Risk Management Process.

This revision updated after gathering information from customer complains, production complains and clinical evaluation for 2013.

', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/pdf', 'partitioner_type': 'vlm_partition', 'filename': 'RMF - bonded manifolds - Rev C.pdf'}
text_as_html:
The aim of this project is to approve 2,3 and 4 gang bonded manifold blistered and sterilized by one cycle of gamma radiation. The bonded stopcocks are of LB (Discofix) and closed stopcock (UltraPort). The project is classified as a design project.

about 3 years ago a design project of bonding economy and LB stopcocks for another Elcam's customer was performed.

This document contains the Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control of the bonded manifolds. The purpose of this document is to identify and minimize risks involved in the design and use of the product using FMEA (Failure Mode & Effect Analysis) method by calculating RPN value (Risk Priority Number), evaluated by the severity, probability and detectability (the rank is described in the "Scale" worksheet).

This project has finished Validation.

This document Does not include risks from the Injection molding of parts, assembly of stopcocks and assembly of the HR valve.

These risks are the same as non-bonded stopcocks and closed stopcocks therefore for risks related to these production processes see documents: "Risk Analysis for stopcocks and manifolds", rev D, March 20, 2014 and "closed stopcocks FMEA", RevE, March 20, 2014.

Both documents exist in Nts02:quality/Risk Management Process.

This revision updated after gathering information from customer complains, production complains and clinical evaluation for 2013.

{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': '9e20b47b0192b23bea81a6da6fb250a0', 'text': 'Mode of Failure - The Hazard, the potential source of harm. Failure Type - classification of the failure Mode whether it is random or systematic Failure. Risk - the Effect of the failure to the use, patient or environment. RPN - Risk Priority number. RPN=Severity*Probability*Detectability. Mitigation Activity - an activity to reduce the RPN number to the minimum possible. ALARP/AFAP - As Low As Reasonably Possible/As Far as Possible. risk rated as ALARP/AFAP must be mitigated. V&V - Verification with Validation', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 2, 'page_number': 1, 'parent_id': 'fccb40cca4f04807b2381d8d439af929', 'text_as_html': '

Mode of Failure - The Hazard, the potential source of harm.

Failure Type - classification of the failure Mode whether it is random or systematic Failure.

Risk - the Effect of the failure to the use, patient or environment.

RPN - Risk Priority number. RPN=Severity*Probability*Detectability.

Mitigation Activity - an activity to reduce the RPN number to the minimum possible.

ALARP/AFAP - As Low As Reasonably Possible/As Far as Possible. risk rated as ALARP/AFAP must be mitigated.

V&V - Verification with Validation

text: Mode of Failure - The Hazard, the potential source of harm. Failure Type - classification of the failure Mode whether it is random or systematic Failure. Risk - the Effect of the failure to the use, patient or environment. RPN - Risk Priority number. RPN=Severity*Probability*Detectability. Mode of Failure - The Hazard, the potential source of harm.

Failure Type - classification of the failure Mode whether it is random or systematic Failure.

Risk - the Effect of the failure to the use, patient or environment.

RPN - Risk Priority number. RPN=Severity*Probability*Detectability.

text_as_html:
Mode of Failure - The Hazard, the potential source of harm.

Failure Type - classification of the failure Mode whether it is random or systematic Failure.

Risk - the Effect of the failure to the use, patient or environment.

RPN - Risk Priority number. RPN=Severity*Probability*Detectability.

Mitigation Activity - an activity to reduce the RPN number to the minimum possible.

ALARP/AFAP - As Low As Reasonably Possible/As Far as Possible. risk rated as ALARP/AFAP must be mitigated.

V&V - Verification with Validation

text_as_html:
The Risk Management Process is performed according to ISO 14971:2007 and BS EN ISO 14971:2012 using the FMEA method.

The FMEA method is described in the Risk Management Plan (RMP -Bonded Manifolds - Rev A, 16-march-2014). The scales and the acceptance criteria appears in that document as well.

The scales for probability, Detectability and severity ratings appears also in the "scale" worksheet.

The Acceptability Criteria:

21Weakening of bonding area of H.R. valve to body due to the UV processSystematic FailureValve disfunction, valve disengagement during handling44116checking ripping torque of cap to body during screening test and during V&V after agingSina & Maysa416
Packaging:
22Slit curing due to storage conditions of time and temperatureSystematic Failureproduct disfunction, not being able to use the valve or difficulty in insertion44116Accelerated aging test during V&VMaysa & Yuval14
23Degradation in silicone valve performance due to UV bonding process combined with Gamma sterilizationSystematic Failureproduct disfunction, not being able to use the valve or difficulty in insertion44232UV curing together with gamma and aging will be performed during V&VMaysa & Yuval18

Risks related to Use

24incorrect information in labelingSystematic Failuremisuse, using a needle or cannula in HR valve2418labeling verification after V&VSina & Maysa12
25Use by unqualified personRandom Failureuding a needle in Valve, assembly by non medical glue, multiple use42432labeling verification after V&VSina & Maysa232

{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': 'f88ace144b587b9da67e2be2316a4908', 'text': 'This document contains Risk Analysis, Evaluation and Control of 2,3 and 4 gang bonded manifolds for B.Braun. The risks of product & process do not refer to the Injection molding process and the assembly processes of handle to body and rotator since these processes are the same as for non-bonded stopcocks and did not need special attention now. This document does not refer to risks related to the side port valve assembly of the closed stopcocks as well from the same reason. For these risks related to pre-bonding see "Risk Analysis of stopcocks and manifols", Rev D. March 16, 2014 and "closed stopcock FMEA", March 2014. An overall of 24 risks were identified so far. 17 of them are related to all bonded stopcocks and 7 of them are relavent only to bonded closed stopcocks and are mentioned apart from the others in the FMEA table.', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 2, 'page_number': 2, 'parent_id': '8be5e436ed4340d39bd358e8d46d7ded', 'text_as_html': '

text: This document contains Risk Analysis, Evaluation and Control of 2,3 and 4 gang bonded manifolds for B.Braun. The risks of product & process do not refer to the Injection molding process and the assembly processes of handle to body and rotator since these processes are the same as for non-bonded stopcocks and did not need special attention now. This document does not refer to risks related to the side port valve assembly of the closed stopcocks as well from the same reason. For these risks related to pre-bonding see "Risk Analysis of stopcocks and manifols", Rev D. March 16, 2014 and "closed stopcock FMEA", March 2014. An overall of 24 risks were identified so far. 17 of them are related to all bonded stopcocks and 7 of them are relavent only to bonded closed stopcocks and are mentioned apart from the others in the FMEA table.

This document contains Risk Analysis, Evaluation and Control of 2,3 and 4 gang bonded manifolds for B.Braun.

The risks of product & process do not refer to the Injection molding process and the assembly processes of handle to body and rotator since these processes are the same as for non-bonded stopcocks and did not need special attention now.

This document does not refer to risks related to the side port valve assembly of the closed stopcocks as well from the same reason.

For these risks related to pre-bonding see "Risk Analysis of stopcocks and manifols", Rev D. March 16, 2014 and "closed stopcock FMEA", March 2014.

An overall of 24 risks were identified so far. 17 of them are related to all bonded stopcocks and 7 of them are relavent only to bonded closed stopcocks and are mentioned apart from the others in the FMEA table.

text_as_html:
This document contains Risk Analysis, Evaluation and Control of 2,3 and 4 gang bonded manifolds for B.Braun.

The risks of product & process do not refer to the Injection molding process and the assembly processes of handle to body and rotator since these processes are the same as for non-bonded stopcocks and did not need special attention now.

This document does not refer to risks related to the side port valve assembly of the closed stopcocks as well from the same reason.

For these risks related to pre-bonding see "Risk Analysis of stopcocks and manifols", Rev D. March 16, 2014 and "closed stopcock FMEA", March 2014.

An overall of 24 risks were identified so far. 17 of them are related to all bonded stopcocks and 7 of them are relavent only to bonded closed stopcocks and are mentioned apart from the others in the FMEA table.

Non are non-acceptable. Risk #12 was added after annual re-evaluation according to information gained from production and post production. text_as_html:
- Number of risks: 17 (13 related to product & process and 4 related to Use)

- 7 of them are Random risks and all others are Systematic risks. systematic risks should be closely monitored in future since they might always occure whenever there are production errors or design faults.

- Mitigation activities were signed for most of these risks.

- RPN values have been reduced due to the activities done: 9 risks are now acceptable and 8 are in the ALARP region. Non are non-acceptable.

Risk #12 was added after annual re-evaluation according to information gained from production and post production. The new number of risks:18.

9 risks are in the ALARP/AFAP region and 9 in the acceptable region.

text_as_html:
- Number of risks: 7 (5 related to product & process and 2 related to Use)

- Mitigation activities were singed to all of these risks. also for the acceptable ones.

3 activities (for risks # 19, 20, 21) have already been mitigated before during a screening test and have reduced the RPN number.

5 of the activities (for risks # 19-23) were mitigated later during the V&V. 3 of them are the same risks as have passed the test during the screening examination (26/2/2007). That is due to the fact that a combination of aging & sterilization &UV might also influence the results.

2 risks (# 24,25) were implemented in labeling.

- RPN values have been reduced due to the activities done: 5 risks are now acceptable and 2 are in the ALARP region. Non are non-acceptable.

text_as_html: 1. Scope & Purpose:

element_id:
{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': '34c09b8d9da0611c1a6e86da53c0a4bb', 'text': 'The bonded stopcocks are of LB and closed stopcock with 2, 3 and 4 gang bonded manifold the difference between bonded manifolds and monoblock-manifolds is that in bonded manifold the stopcocks are single stopcocks bonded to one another by UV bonding process while in monoblocks their bodies are molded all at once in advance with no need for additional bonding to create 2, 3 and 4 gangs. This document contains the Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control of the bonded manifolds. The purpose of this document is to identify and minimize risks involved in the design and use of the product using FMEA (Failure Mode & Effect Analysis) method by calculating RPN value (Risk Priority Number), evaluated by the severity, probability and detectability (the rank is described in the "Scale" worksheet). This project has finished Validation. This document Does not include risks from the Injection molding of parts, assembly of stopcocks and assembly of the HR valve. These risks are the same as non-bonded stopcocks and closed stopcocks therefore for risks related to these production processes see their FMEAs. This File is the sixth revision updated after gathering information from customer complains, production complains and clinical evaluation for 2015', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 2, 'page_number': 1, 'parent_id': 'f4a316f0e9af49f6aa7ab12c6f7a54b4', 'text_as_html': '

The bonded stopcocks are of LB and closed stopcock with 2, 3 and 4 gang bonded manifold

the difference between bonded manifolds and monoblock-manifolds is that in bonded manifold the stopcocks are single stopcocks bonded to one another by UV bonding process while in monoblocks their bodies are molded all at once in advance with no need for additional bonding to create 2, 3 and 4 gangs.

This document contains the Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control of the bonded manifolds. The purpose of this document is to identify and minimize risks involved in the design and use of the product using FMEA (Failure Mode & Effect Analysis) method by calculating RPN value (Risk Priority Number), evaluated by the severity, probability and detectability (the rank is described in the "Scale" worksheet).

This project has finished Validation.

This document Does not include risks from the Injection molding of parts, assembly of stopcocks and assembly of the HR valve.

These risks are the same as non-bonded stopcocks and closed stopcocks therefore for risks related to these production processes see their FMEAs.

This File is the sixth revision updated after gathering information from customer complains, production complains and clinical evaluation for 2015

', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/pdf', 'partitioner_type': 'vlm_partition', 'filename': 'RMF- Bonded Manifolds -Rev G_scanned for TF.pdf'}}
text: The bonded stopcocks are of LB and closed stopcock with 2, 3 and 4 gang bonded manifold the difference between bonded manifolds and monoblock-manifolds is that in bonded manifold the stopcocks are single stopcocks bonded to one another by UV bonding process while in monoblocks their bodies are molded all at once in advance with no need for additional bonding to create 2, 3 and 4 gangs. This document contains the Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control of the bonded manifolds. The purpose of this document is to identify and minimize risks involved in the design and use of the product using FMEA (Failure Mode & Effect Analysis) method by calculating RPN value (Risk Priority Number), evaluated by the severity, probability and detectability (the rank is described in the "Scale" worksheet). This project has finished Validation. This document Does not include risks from the Injection molding of parts, assembly of stopcocks and assembly of the HR valve. These risks are the same as non-bonded stopcocks and closed stopcocks therefore for risks related to these production processes see their FMEAs. This File is the sixth revision updated after gathering information from customer complains, production complains and clinical evaluation for 2015

The bonded stopcocks are of LB and closed stopcock with 2, 3 and 4 gang bonded manifold

the difference between bonded manifolds and monoblock-manifolds is that in bonded manifold the stopcocks are single stopcocks bonded to one another by UV bonding process while in monoblocks their bodies are molded all at once in advance with no need for additional bonding to create 2, 3 and 4 gangs.

This document contains the Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control of the bonded manifolds. The purpose of this document is to identify and minimize risks involved in the design and use of the product using FMEA (Failure Mode & Effect Analysis) method by calculating RPN value (Risk Priority Number), evaluated by the severity, probability and detectability (the rank is described in the "Scale" worksheet).

This project has finished Validation.

This document Does not include risks from the Injection molding of parts, assembly of stopcocks and assembly of the HR valve.

', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/pdf', 'partitioner_type': 'vlm_partition', 'filename': 'RMF- Bonded Manifolds -Rev G_scanned for TF.pdf'}

text_as_html:
The bonded stopcocks are of LB and closed stopcock with 2, 3 and 4 gang bonded manifold

the difference between bonded manifolds and monoblock-manifolds is that in bonded manifold the stopcocks are single stopcocks bonded to one another by UV bonding process while in monoblocks their bodies are molded all at once in advance with no need for additional bonding to create 2, 3 and 4 gangs.

This document contains the Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control of the bonded manifolds. The purpose of this document is to identify and minimize risks involved in the design and use of the product using FMEA (Failure Mode & Effect Analysis) method by calculating RPN value (Risk Priority Number), evaluated by the severity, probability and detectability (the rank is described in the "Scale" worksheet).

This project has finished Validation.

This document Does not include risks from the Injection molding of parts, assembly of stopcocks and assembly of the HR valve.

These risks are the same as non-bonded stopcocks and closed stopcocks therefore for risks related to these production processes see their FMEAs.

This File is the sixth revision updated after gathering information from customer complains, production complains and clinical evaluation for 2015

element_id:
{'type': 'NarrativeText', 'element_id': 'bd9b9400e54dc9b05e46325469bb367f', 'text': 'Hazardous Situation - Circumstances in which people, property or environment are exposed to one or more potential source(s) of harm. Cause(s) of Failure - the engineering reason(s) to cause hazardous situation. Failure Type - classification of the failure Mode whether it is random or systematic Failure. Potential Effect of the failure - potential harm to the user, patient or environment or effect on image or manufacturing. RPN - Risk Priority number. RPN=Severity*Probability*Detectability. Mitigation Activity - an activity to reduce the RPN number to the minimum possible. ALARP/AFAP - As Low As Reasonably Possible/As Far as Possible. V&V - Verification with Validation FMEA - Failure Mode and Effect Analysis. QC - Quality Control inspection during routine production. S=Severity, P=Probability, D=Detectability', 'metadata': {'category_depth': 2, 'page_number': 1, 'parent_id': '2bd3ecb4e8814c35a6be5fe5ec81cdf6', 'text_as_html': '

Hazardous Situation - Circumstances in which people, property or environment are exposed to one or more potential source(s) of harm.

Cause(s) of Failure - the engineering reason(s) to cause hazardous situation.

Failure Type - classification of the failure Mode whether it is random or systematic Failure.

Potential Effect of the failure - potential harm to the user, patient or environment or effect on image or manufacturing.

RPN - Risk Priority number. RPN=Severity*Probability*Detectability.

Mitigation Activity - an activity to reduce the RPN number to the minimum possible.

ALARP/AFAP - As Low As Reasonably Possible/As Far as Possible.

V&V - Verification with Validation

FMEA - Failure Mode and Effect Analysis.

QC - Quality Control inspection during routine production.

S=Severity, P=Probability, D=Detectability

', 'languages': ['eng'], 'filetype': 'application/pdf', 'partitioner_type': 'vlm_partition', 'filename': 'RMF- Bonded Manifolds -Rev G_scanned for TF.pdf'}}

text_as_html:
Hazardous Situation - Circumstances in which people, property or environment are exposed to one or more potential source(s) of harm.

Cause(s) of Failure - the engineering reason(s) to cause hazardous situation.

Failure Type - classification of the failure Mode whether it is random or systematic Failure.

Potential Effect of the failure - potential harm to the user, patient or environment or effect on image or manufacturing.

RPN - Risk Priority number. RPN=Severity*Probability*Detectability.

Mitigation Activity - an activity to reduce the RPN number to the minimum possible.

ALARP/AFAP - As Low As Reasonably Possible/As Far as Possible.

V&V - Verification with Validation

FMEA - Failure Mode and Effect Analysis.

QC - Quality Control inspection during routine production.

S=Severity, P=Probability, D=Detectability

The Risk Management Process is performed according to ISO 14971:2007 and BS EN ISO 14971:2012 using the FMEA method.

The FMEA method is described in the Risk Management Plan (RMP -Bonded Manifolds - Rev B, 29-Dec-2016).

The scales for probability, Detectability and severity ratings appears also in the "scale" worksheet of this document.
